hero.headline: Best Miniature YouTube Tools 2025
hero.subheadline: Capture tiny details. Gear for miniature painting creators.

sections.content: Miniature painting content showcases incredibly detailed work at tiny scales—28mm warriors, terrain pieces, dioramas. Viewers need to see brush strokes on faces and subtle blending. This demands specialized macro photography, excellent lighting, and stable filming. Here's what successful mini painters use.

content.title: Extension Tubes
content.description: Budget macro solution. Add to existing lens.

content.title: Light Box/Tent
content.description: Diffused even light. No harsh shadows.

content.title: Multiple Sources
content.description: Front + sides. Reduce shadows in details.

content.title: Dimmable
content.description: Adjust for metallic, NMM, different effects.

content.title: Backdrop
content.description: Neutral gray or gradient. Focus on mini.

sections.title: Mini Content Tips
content: Good lighting reveals detail you painted

faq.question: Best macro lens for miniatures?
faq.answer: 60mm or 90mm macro lenses popular. Sony 90mm, Canon 100mm excellent. Even kit lens with extension tubes works. True 1:1 macro ratio ideal for 28mm scale.

faq.question: How to light metallic paint?
faq.answer: Larger light sources reduce harsh reflections. Light tents work well. Experiment with angles—metallic reflects differently. Some creators prefer controlled single source for NMM.

faq.question: Filming painting process?
faq.answer: Overhead camera for painting. Side angle for holding mini. Time-lapse long sessions. Real-time for technique explanations. Multiple camera angles add production value.

faq.question: Focus stacking for photos?
faq.answer: Multiple images at different focus points, combined in software. Helicon Focus, Photoshop work. Critical for final showcase shots where entire mini must be sharp. Less relevant for video.
